intro: Noronhia peglerae, commonly known as the KwaZulu-Natal starling tree, is a rare and endemic species native to the subtropical regions of South Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree characterized by its dense, glossy foliage and distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. Noronhia peglerae thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
